page.title: 19ABBOTSKERSWELL POSTMISTRESS
page.content: When we interviewed Mrs Fey B.E.M,the village postmistress, she told us that the post office was built 400 years ago and that she came to work in the post office 49 years ago.Mrs Fey played the organ in church for 70 years .The post office times are as follows: 9 a.m till 1 p.m. then 2 p.m till 5.30 p.m. Wednesday and Saturday are half closing days. In the old days there was a man called Mr Warren who ran a taxi from Abbotskerswell to Newton Abbot and that was 2 pence fare.Mrs Fey's husband and his father helped to rebuild the church.Mrs Fey likes the village and wouldn't leave it if she had the chance to, but one thing she doesn't like about the village is the new houses in Wilton Way and the council houses.
